intro: Teucrium miragestorum, commonly known as the mirage thyme, is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and flowering stems. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are often used in culinary applications, similar to other thyme species, and possess a fragrant, slightly minty aroma. Teucrium miragestorum is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties.
